questions.prompt: 1944: fdr wins an unprecedented fourth term in office, defeating ____; harry truman is vp?

First organized use of kamikaze (suicide) aircraft by the japanese at this largest gulf battle.?
1944: at the dumbarton oaks conference in washington, dc, groundwork is set for what will become the ___?
1945: in what will become a pulitzer-prize-winning photo, who captures marines placing flag atop mount suribachi, on iwo jima (whose name means “sulfur island”)?

1945: fdr dies at warms springs, georgia, on april 12; who becomes president?
1944: on june 6, allied forces land 150,000 men on beaches of normandy for ____, also known as operation overlord; beaches are named omaha, utah, gold sword and juno?
1943: fdr meets in cairo with winston churchill and ____?
1943: richard rodgers and oscar hammerstein have first collaborative hit in ____?
1943: fdr dedicates the ____ memorial in washington, dc?
1943: us forces under george patton are driven back at kasserine pass, tunisia, by _______; us later pushes ____ back?
1943: us defeats japanese at ______, known by japanese soldiers as “starvation island”?
1942: under this italian physicist, team of scientists working under stands at university of chicago football field create first atomic chain reaction?
Who was the leader of the free french?
1942: whor is given command of american forces in europe?
1942: two aircraft carriers--japan's shoho and us's lexington, sunk in this battle?
1942: who leads us squadron of b-25s in a raid on tokyo and other japanese cities; raids became the basis for the book 30 seconds over tokyo.?
1942: japanese lose one heavy cruiser, four fleet carriers and 300 aircraft at this battle. two japanese carriers, kaga and akagi, were found by deep-sea explorers in 2019.?
